data.meanings: to turn the back, flee, follow after, be behind, become old, take a thing away, veer to the west wind, elapse (day, night), follow with respect.Back, hinder part, the last, extremity, that which comes after, at the end of, extreme, last remnant, uttermost part.To dispose, manage, govern, consider, the issues or results of the affairs or the case, perform or execute the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair, regulate.Consequence, result.idbar = retreat, withdrawal, setting.
data.sentence: The word أَدْبَرَ comes from the root د ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to turn the back, flee, follow after, be behind, become old, take a thing away, veer to the west wind, elapse (day, night), follow with respect.Back, hinder part, the last, extremity, that which comes after, at the end of, extreme, last remnant, uttermost part.To dispose, manage, govern, consider, the issues or results of the affairs or the case, perform or execute the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair, regulate.Consequence, result.idbar = retreat, withdrawal, setting.

data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word وَاللَّيْلِ comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
